title: Algeria: Algeria Significantly Invests in Renewable Energies, Says Royal
text:
Algeria Significantly Invests in Renewable Energies, Says Royal Tagged: Morocco: AU Commission Chairperson Reiterates Firm Position for Decolonization of Western Sahara 
Algiers — Algeria is a country that significantly invests in the field of energy transition, notably the renewable energies, said Saturday in Algiers, French Minister for Ecology, Sustainable Development and Energy, Segolene Royal. 
Speaking to the press following her audience with President of the Republic Abdelaziz Bouteflika, Royal said that Algeria, which is a "key" country in the world as producer of fossil energy, is investing a lot in the renewable energy, waste treatment and water sanitation, as part of the energy transition. 
Noting the existence of several projects in Algeria as part of the energy transition, she emphasized the importance of all the investments made in this area during the Paris Conference on Climate Change (COP-21) scheduled in Paris in December. 
In this regard, the French minister said having handed over to President Bouteflika "a letter from his French counterpart Francois Hollande, who thanked him for his commitment to COP-21." 
"France relies on Algeria for the success of the Paris Conference on Climate," she said, recalling that Algeria, on 20 September, sent a contribution on the subject. 
In addition, Royal said having discussed with the Head of State about the climate and security issues to be discussed at COP-21, like biodiversity. 
President Bouteflika "is very concerned, involved and connoisseur of all the sciences," Royal concluded. Algeria
